Customer can deploy self-managed NVAs like FireWall, Loadbalancer, etc, inside of AVS Private Cloud. From NSX-T&rsquo;s point of view it is just another Virtual Machine (VM).
Here, NVA has to be in routed path, where, it acts as network gateway for the layer 3 segment. From scale point of view, ESXi supports 10 network interfaces per VM. 1 interface can be used for uplink 1 for management 8 segments are then left to create security zones. Security zone in these options can either be &lsquo;a segment&rsquo; or &lsquo;an isolated NSX-T T1 gateway&rsquo; On the NSX-T T1, configure a summary static route for all the south-bound segments with next hop set to NVA.

VMware&rsquo;s Hybrid Cloud eXtension (HCX) platform can be used to:
Migrate Virtual Machine from source datacenter to AVS Migrate Network segment from source datacenter to AVS In this article we&rsquo;ll explore steps which can be taken to seemlessly migrate network from VMware based source datacenter over to AVS.
Network Migration States We&rsquo;ll explore the transition with the following states:
Initial State: where source datacenter has network connection to AVS private cloud. Intermediate Network Extension State: where a layer 2 network segment has been extended to AVS. Intermediate Optimized Local Routing State (Optional): where local smart routing is enabled within AVS. Final Network Migration State: where network gateway is migrated to AVS.
